page.title: 07DAISY BANK FARM,TOFT
page.content: ARTHUR BURGESS HAS WORKED AT THE FARM SINCE 1927,FIFTY-EIGHT YEARS AGO.HE STARTED AGED NINE YEARS.HE LIVES IN A BRICK COTTAGE NEARBY.HE STARTS WORK AT SIX A.M.AND FINISHES AT SIX P.M. IN WINTER AND TEN P.M. IN SUMMER. THERE ARE 120 ACRES OF LAND.THEY GROW BARLEY,POTATOES AND GRASS FOR HAY.THERE ARE FORTY FRESIAN COWS AND ONE BULL. HIS MAIN JOBS ARE MILKING,TRACTOR DRIVING,HAY BALING AND HARVESTING POTATOES.THEY BUY COWS AT CHELFORD MARKET AND SELL HAY,STRAW,COWS,BULLS AND CALVES,THERE. HE OCCASIONALLY DOES HEDGE-CUTTING,DRAINING AND DITCHING,AND PLOUGHING.HE SOMETIMES HAS TO GET UP IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT TO ATTEND TO THE ANIMALS. HE LOVES FARMING AND ENJOYS HIS LIFE.
